summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 8, 2019, discussing operational planning for a search warrant execution at Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, in the U.S. Virgin Islands. It details logistics, personnel travel, and the status of the investigation, including ongoing victim interviews and digital evidence processing.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Author of the main operational email detailing plans for the search of Epstein's island. He is the SSA for Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) at the FBI New York office.

events.title: Case agents travel to St. Thomas
events.description: FBI case agents are sent to St. Thomas to swear out a search warrant and conduct key interviews of employees.

events.title: FBI team travel to Virgin Islands
events.description: The main FBI team of approximately 40 personnel plans to fly down to St. Thomas on an FBI Q400 plane.

events.title: Planned search warrant execution on Little St. James
events.description: The FBI plans to execute a search warrant at 6am on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James.

locations: Little St. James (Epstein's island, U.S. Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The FBI was planning a major search operation on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, involving approximately 40 personnel.
One co-conspirator had been served, described as a British citizen who was 'currently out of pocket'.
Victim and witness interviews were ongoing, and digital media seized from Epstein's residence was being processed by CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team).
The SDNY (Southern District of New York) was working with lawyers on co-conspirator cooperation.
The planned search of the 70+ acre island with several structures was anticipated to take 1-3 days.
